solution_line_template: Each of the other pills cost {cheap_pill_cost}+{extra_cost_per_expensive_pill} = <<{cheap_pill_cost}+{extra_cost_per_expensive_pill}={expensive_pill_cost}>>{expensive_pill_cost} dollars each.

The {expensive_pills_per_day} pills cost a total of {expensive_pill_cost}*{expensive_pills_per_day} = <<{expensive_pill_cost}*{expensive_pills_per_day}={total_expensive_pill_cost_per_day}>>{total_expensive_pill_cost_per_day} dollars.

The first {cheap_pills_per_day} pills cost {cheap_pill_cost}*{cheap_pills_per_day} = <<{cheap_pill_cost}*{cheap_pills_per_day}={total_cheap_pill_cost_per_day}>>{total_cheap_pill_cost_per_day} dollars in total.

Henry spent a total of {total_expensive_pill_cost_per_day}+{total_cheap_pill_cost_per_day} = <<{total_expensive_pill_cost_per_day}+{total_cheap_pill_cost_per_day}={total_cost_per_day}>>{total_cost_per_day} dollars.
